original: I had a couple of questions, but I didn't ask them.
translated: J'avais quelques questions mais je ne les ai pas posées.

original: Didn't I show you my new Mustang?
translated: Je ne t'ai pas montré ma nouvelle Mustang ?

original: This is the end.
translated: C'est la fin.

original: Tom has a terrible memory.
translated: Tom a une mauvaise mémoire.

original: My computer doesn't work anymore.
translated: Mon ordinateur ne fonctionne plus.

original: We can handle that.
translated: Nous savons y faire.

original: I thought I'd never see you alive again.
translated: Je pensais que je ne te reverrais jamais vivant.

original: The United States have been dubbed the "world policeman", but some American intellectuals do not hesitate to call their own country "rogue state."
translated: Les États-Unis ont été surnommés le « gendarme du monde », mais certains intellectuels américains n'hésitent pas à appeler leur propre pays « État voyou ».

original: I must send for the doctor.
translated: Il faut que j'appelle le médecin.

original: To tell the truth, I didn't notice it.
translated: À vrai dire, je ne l'ai pas remarqué.

original: I want a lot.

original: We cannot change the past.
translated: Nous ne pouvons pas changer le passé.

original: The period is missing.
translated: Il manque le point.

original: As you sow, so will you reap.
translated: On récolte ce que l'on sème.

original: I'm concentrating.
translated: Je suis en cours de concentration.

original: The baby is crawling.
translated: Le bébé marche à quatre pattes.

original: He put the key on the desk as usual.
translated: Il posa la clé sur le bureau, comme d'habitude.

original: Tom is a good friend of yours, isn't he?
translated: Tom est un bon ami à toi, n'est-ce pas ?

original: Is that your biro?
translated: C'est votre stylo ?

original: His height is a great advantage when he plays volleyball.
translated: Sa hauteur est un grand avantage quand il joue au volley-ball.

original: Last week we worked day and night.
translated: La semaine dernière nous avons travaillé jour et nuit.

original: How can we get past this crisis?

original: I'd like an aisle seat, please.
translated: Je voudrais un siège côté couloir, s'il vous plaît.

original: How much money do I owe you?
translated: Combien d'argent vous dois-je ?

original: What on earth are you doing here?

original: I was impressed with her work.
translated: J'ai été impressionné par son travail.

original: He could not come because he was ill.
translated: Il ne pouvait pas venir parce qu'il était malade.

original: Why didn't you come to class?
translated: Pourquoi n'es-tu pas venue en cours ?

original: I agreed to write that letter.
translated: Je consentis à écrire cette lettre.

original: Was Tom handsome?
translated: Tom était-il bel homme ?

original: She pretended to be a student.
translated: Elle se fit passer pour une étudiante.

original: Is there a reward?
translated: Y a-t-il une récompense ?

original: Tell me why I shouldn't fire you.
translated: Dis-moi pourquoi je ne devrais pas te virer.

original: He painted the door green all over.
translated: Il a peint la porte tout en vert.

original: Tom suffers from headaches.
translated: Tom souffre de maux de tête.

original: Open the safe.
translated: Ouvrez le coffre !

original: I think maybe Tom needs me.
translated: Je pense que Tom a besoin de moi.

original: I don't want to hurt my son's feelings.
translated: Je ne veux pas blesser les sentiments de mon fils.

original: I'll put some salt on the meat.
translated: Je mettrai un peu de sel sur la viande.

original: Life begins at forty.
translated: La vie commence à quarante ans.

original: I don't need a car that big.
translated: Je n'ai pas besoin d'une si voiture grosse.

original: A lot of people feel the same way you do.
translated: Beaucoup de gens ressentent la même chose que vous.

original: He was covered with sweat.
translated: Il était couvert de sueur.

original: I can't believe I'm still alive.
translated: Je n'arrive pas à croire que je sois toujours en vie.

original: She's a jealous woman.
translated: C'est une femme jalouse.

original: We can travel through time. And we do at the remarkable rate of one second per second.
translated: Nous pouvons voyager dans le temps. Et nous le faisons à la vitesse incroyable d’une seconde par seconde.

original: The maid made my bed.
translated: La bonne a fait mon lit.

original: The plane disappeared in the twinkle of an eye.
translated: L'avion disparut en un clin d'œil.

original: I met your son yesterday and he greeted me politely.
translated: J'ai rencontré ton fils hier et il m'a poliment salué.

original: Tom must unfortunately contradict you.
translated: Tom doit malheureusement vous contredire.

original: France is in western Europe.
translated: La France est en Europe occidentale.

original: I had to study French when I was in high school.
translated: J'ai dû étudier le français quand j'étais au lycée.

original: I almost never do that.
translated: Je ne fais presque jamais cela.

original: I'm happy to see so many friendly faces.
translated: Je suis heureux de voir tant de visages amicaux.

original: Are you sure this is the right address?
translated: Tu es sûr que c'est la bonne adresse?

original: I fully support your proposal.
translated: Je soutiens intégralement ta proposition.

original: Be curious.
translated: Soyez curieuse.

original: My favorite singer is THE ALFEE.
translated: Mon chanteur favori est THE ALFEE.

original: Did you vote in the last election?
translated: Avez-vous voté à la dernière élection ?

original: Tom is as smart as you.
translated: Tom est aussi malin que toi.

original: This is everything I've ever wanted.
translated: C'est tout ce que j'ai jamais désiré.

original: If it's that hot, how about you take off all your clothes?
translated: S'il fait si chaud que ça, pourquoi ne retires-tu pas tous tes vêtements ?

original: Her age qualifies her for the job.

original: The IMF ruled out any new loans to that country.
translated: Le FMI a exclu tout nouveau prêt à ce pays.

original: Marie put on her most beautiful dress to go to the theater.
translated: Marie a mis sa plus belle robe pour aller au théâtre.

original: I'm sorry you got dragged into this.
translated: Je suis désolé que tu aies été entraîné là-dedans.

original: She committed suicide yesterday.
translated: Elle s'est suicidée hier.

original: You think in a way that is very meticulous.
translated: Tu réfléchis en fait de manière très méticuleuse.

original: The meeting was just about over.
translated: La réunion prenait fin.

original: Never mind what happened.
translated: Oubliez ce qu'il s'est passé.

original: My eye has swollen up.
translated: Mon œil a gonflé.

original: His boss was quite impressed.
translated: Son patron a été assez impressionné.

original: I feel as if I were dreaming.
translated: Je me sens comme en rêve.

original: Don't judge me too harshly.
translated: Ne me juge pas trop durement !

original: I woke up and I thought: "Did that really happen?"
translated: Je me suis réveillé et je me suis dit : « Est-ce vraiment arrivé ? »

original: He decided to go abroad.
translated: Il a décidé d'aller à l'étranger.

original: She's busy with her work.
translated: Elle est affairée.

original: Have at you!

original: What was she doing when you saw her?
translated: Qu'était-elle en train de faire lorsque tu l'as vue ?

original: I didn't mean to wake her up.
translated: Je ne voulais pas la réveiller.

original: We're going to my folks' for Christmas this year.
translated: Nous allons chez mes parents pour Noël cette année.

original: He's taking a shower.
translated: Il est en train de prendre une douche.

original: Be merciful.
translated: Soyez clémente !

original: I'm nowhere as much interested in the Frequently Asked Questions as I am in the Frequently Given Answers.
translated: Je ne suis pas du tout aussi intéressé par les Questions Fréquemment Posées que par les Réponses Fréquemment Données.

original: You've thought of everything, haven't you?
translated: Tu as pensé à tout, hein ?

original: This road is gritted when it's icy.
translated: Cette rue est sablée en cas de verglas.

original: Am I the only one that agrees with you?
translated: Suis-je le seul d'accord avec toi ?

original: The U.S. Postal Service could shut down as early as next year.
translated: Le service des postes des États-Unis d'Amérique pourrait fermer dès l'année prochaine.

original: I want to meet with Tom.
translated: Je veux voir Tom.

original: You are killing me slowly.
translated: Tu me tues à petit feu.

original: Life is fun.
translated: La vie est amusante.

original: Come a bit closer.
translated: Approchez-vous un peu plus !

original: Scram!
translated: Fichez le camp.

original: We've run out of tea.
translated: Nous n'avons plus de thé.

original: They won't let Tom in.
translated: Ils ne laisseront pas Tom entrer.

original: I don't know how to express my thanks.
translated: Je ne sais pas comment vous remercier.

original: Who broke the window?
translated: Qui a brisé la vitre ?

original: I'll tell him when he comes here.
translated: Je le lui dirai quand il viendra ici.

original: Did Dorenda really come back?!
translated: Est-ce que Dorenda est vraiment revenue ?

original: Tom is a very rich person.
translated: Tom est très riche.

original: He saw it also.
translated: Il l'a vu aussi.

original: If you don't want to do it, you don't have to.
translated: Si vous ne voulez pas le faire, vous n'y êtes pas obligés.

original: You will save your father a lot of worry if you simply write him a letter.
translated: Tu éviteras à ton père de se faire beaucoup de soucis, simplement en lui écrivant une lettre.

original: Do you want to become a father?
translated: Voulez-vous devenir père ?

original: I can't tune into the radio station. The tuning knob is broken on the radio.
translated: Je ne peux pas régler les stations de la radio. Le bouton de sélection des stations de la radio est cassé.

original: He would be a very sad man, seeing his dream come to naught.
translated: Il serait un homme triste, de voir son rêve réduit à néant.

original: Did anyone call me?
translated: Quiconque m'a-t-il appelé ?

original: This poem was originally written in French.
translated: Ce poème était écrit en français à l'origine.

original: I feel like a drink.
translated: J'ai envie de boire un coup.

original: I hear Lise singing.
translated: J’entends Lise chanter.

original: You're very attractive.
translated: Tu es très attirant.

original: How much longer do we have to stay here?
translated: Combien de temps encore devons-nous rester ici ?

original: I have been expecting you.
translated: Je vous ai attendu.

original: Tom wondered how long it would take to finish the job.
translated: Tom se demandait combien de temps il faudrait pour terminer le travail.

original: I liked that.
translated: J'ai aimé ça.

original: He thoughtfully gave me a helping hand.
translated: Il m'a généreusement donné un coup de main.

original: My blood pressure is low.
translated: Ma pression sanguine est faible.

original: Are you sure you don't want coffee?
translated: Êtes-vous sûr de ne pas vouloir de café ?

original: These pancakes are really delicious.
translated: Ces crêpes sont vraiment délicieuses.

original: He must be an American.
translated: Il doit être américain.

original: Sell it!
translated: Vends-le !

original: I forgot to tell them.
translated: J'ai oublié de leur raconter.

original: I don't understand what you're trying to achieve.
translated: Je ne comprends pas ce que vous essayez d'accomplir.

original: That is the office where he works.
translated: C'est le bureau dans lequel il travaille.

original: Show me the list.
translated: Montrez-moi la liste.

original: In the name of the Brazilian president, Luiz Inacio Lula de Silva, Claudio Soarez Rocha expressed admiration for the continuing effort which Esperanto-speaking people throughout the world are always making, for the greater spread of Esperanto. He wrote, amongst other things,"We know that in the history of mankind, there have been languages that have become intrusive as a result of political power, such as Latin, or to a certain extent French and lately, English. We very much wish, in fact, that one day Esperanto could be accepted by the majority of the nations, as a language adopted to facilitate communication without linguistic privileges."
translated: Au nom du Président brésilien, Louis Ignace Lula da Silva, Claude Soarez Rocha a exprimé son admiration pour l'effort soutenu que les espérantophones du monde entier font continûment, pour la plus grande diffusion de l'espéranto. Il a écrit, entre autres choses : « Nous savons que dans l'histoire de l'humanité, il y a eu des langues qui se sont imposées par l'opération du pouvoir politique, tel que le latin, ou dans une certaine mesure, le français et récemment, l'anglais. Nous souhaitons ardemment, en vérité, qu'un jour l'espéranto soit accepté par la majorité des nations en tant que langue adoptée afin de faciliter la communication sans privilèges linguistiques. »

original: Where can I speak with you?
translated: Où puis-je vous parler ?

original: Would you like to take a recess?
translated: Voudriez-vous prendre des congés ?

original: Yuriko is planning to move into the furniture business.
translated: Yuriko envisage de travailler dans le commerce de meubles.

original: Since when did you become so high and mighty?

original: Tom worked for an oil company.
translated: Tom travaillait pour une société pétrolière.

original: I would like to buy myself a new computer; show me the best model.
translated: J'aimerais m'acheter un nouvel ordinateur, conseillez-moi le meilleur modèle.

original: We asked Tom some questions.
translated: Nous avons posé quelques questions à Tom.

original: Could you bring us a fork?

original: I have some advice for you.

original: I think you're a genius.
translated: Je pense que tu es un génie.

original: I go swimming every chance that I get.
translated: Je vais à la piscine chaque fois que j'en ai l'occasion.

original: I want you to be prepared.
translated: Je veux que vous soyez préparée.

original: My father is fifty years old.
translated: Mon père a cinquante ans.

original: Politicians can't be trusted.
translated: On ne peut faire confiance aux politiciens.

original: Tom isn't wearing a red tie.
translated: Tom ne porte pas de cravate rouge.

original: How old are your kids?

original: Are my socks dry yet?

original: Stop asking!

original: He should have come.
translated: Il aurait dû venir.

original: Wanna bet?

original: After careful consideration, I have decided not to accept this offer.
translated: Après mûre réflexion, j'ai décidé de ne pas accepter cette proposition.

original: You're courteous.

original: "I don't like carrots." "Neither do I."

original: Do you cook by gas or electricity?

original: Are you happy with how you look?

original: Previous episodes of mass extinctions were driven by natural disasters such as asteroids, but this one is driven by humans.
translated: Les épisodes antérieurs d'extinction de masse furent provoqués par des cataclysmes naturels tels que des astéroïdes, mais celui-ci est provoqué par les humains.

original: I'm taking it with me.

original: When do you expect to have your Christmas shopping done?

original: It's too late to turn back now.

original: The girl goes to school.

original: He who speaks the truth needs a swift horse.
translated: Donne un cheval à celui qui dit la vérité, il en aura besoin pour s'enfuir.

original: Where did you get this info?

original: Oh, you can talk as much as you like. I don't mind.

original: I never imagined I'd feel this way about you.

original: He grabbed my ass!

original: I'm not gay.

original: We want to negotiate.

original: She really ate too much.

original: She was looking forward to going sailing with him.
translated: Elle se réjouissait d'aller faire de la voile avec lui.

original: I've been asked to help Tom.

original: This is your bedroom.

original: Tom disappointed me.

original: He will soon be past playing with toys.

original: This plane is his.

original: I'm saving up so that I can go to Australia.

original: You may go if you wish. It's up to you.

original: The painter who did this painting won an award.
translated: Le peintre qui a fait ce tableau a gagné un prix.

original: Let's end this debate.

original: You don't seem very concerned.

original: Tom knows guns.

original: It's rare for me to get invited to parties.

original: Can you tell me how you found out that Tom wasn't at school today?

original: I'm not intimidated.

original: Guess what happened to me.

original: Do you have money for a ticket?

original: I'd like to see her.

original: Come back to bed, honey.

original: That's all you can do.

original: It's a dead giveaway.

original: You should not have done that. It was wrong.

original: Can you juggle?

original: I suspect Tom does that once in a while.

original: She cannot be over thirty.

original: I had a dream.

original: Do you want some tea?

original: Do you live in this dorm?

original: She likes nothing but the best.

original: You may pay in advance for your order.

original: She glimpsed him running through the crowd.

original: I am indifferent to others' opinions.

original: I've not read today's paper yet.

original: Tom's bike is blue.

original: Sea turtles are magnificent creatures.

original: It's hard to surprise you.

original: Use it or lose it.

original: Happy birthday, Dad.

original: Don't come here.

original: Mary paid no attention to him.

original: Don't wait dinner for me.

original: There's more to this than meets the eye.

original: I wore a vampire costume, and had fake fangs.

original: He's such a cold fish.

original: Tom's father promised to buy him a motorcycle.

original: It was a terrible affair.

original: Wives, submit yourselves to your own husbands as you do to the Lord. For the husband is the head of the wife as Christ is the head of the church, his body, of which he is the Savior.
translated: Femmes, soyez soumises à vos maris, comme au Seigneur; car le mari est le chef de la femme, comme Christ est le chef de l'Église, qui est son corps, et dont il est le Sauveur.

original: I found it difficult to please her.

original: Tom can speak French.

original: Tom is playing.

original: I despise Tom.

original: I have a truck.

original: The unstable security situation in Syria also affects Turkey.

original: It's not anybody's fault.

original: I agree with you on this point.

original: He used to tell me stories about India.

original: "Will you have another cup of coffee?" "No, thank you."

original: I've put on a lot of weight since Christmas.

original: I'll be better in a minute.

original: Rats have gnawed holes in the door.

original: Sami got into the stadium and found a seat.
translated: Sami entra dans le stade et trouva un siège.

original: There is an urgent need for a more effective method of treating this disease.
translated: On a un besoin urgent d'une méthode plus efficace pour traiter cette maladie.

original: It's brand new.
translated: C'est flambant neuf.

original: He was doubtful at first but soon came to embrace my advice.
translated: Il était tout d'abord suspicieux mais rapidement il vint à souscrire à mon conseil.

original: Don't be so negative.
translated: Ne soyez pas si négatif !

original: She had the decency to apologize.
translated: Elle a eu la décence de présenter ses excuses.

original: I had my watch repaired at the store.
translated: J'ai fait réparer ma montre au magasin.

original: We should work faster.
translated: Nous devons travailler plus vite.

original: I'm very happy with the results.
translated: Je suis très content des résultats.

original: That's not how that works.
translated: Ce n'est pas comme ça que ça marche.

original: How do you know for sure?
translated: Comment en sont-ils sûrs ?

original: I understand your problem.
translated: Je comprends ton problème.

original: I am eating fried fish.
translated: Je mange du poisson pané.

original: I think we're looking for different things.
translated: Je pense que nous recherchons des choses différentes.

original: I want to write a book.
translated: Je veux écrire un livre.

original: She travelled around Europe.
translated: Elle fit le tour de l’Europe.

original: Tom isn't accustomed to working at night.
translated: Tom n'est pas habitué à travailler la nuit.

original: I want to ask you some questions.
translated: Je veux te poser des questions.

original: Now, I would like you to imagine a map of Great Britain.
translated: Maintenant, je voudrais que tu t'imagines une carte de la Grande-Bretagne.

original: Aren't you convinced?
translated: N'es-tu pas convaincu?

original: So, what can I do for you?
translated: Alors, que puis-je faire pour toi ?

original: We're doomed.
translated: Nous sommes condamnés.

original: A lot of people were in the room.
translated: Dans la salle il y avait beaucoup de monde.

original: I seldom see him.
translated: Je le vois rarement.

original: Don't forget to bring your umbrella in case it rains.
translated: N'oubliez pas de prendre votre parapluie au cas où il pleuvrait.

original: What's your son's name?
translated: Comment s'appelle ton fils ?

original: You're so impatient.
translated: Tu es tellement impatient.

original: I paid attention.
translated: J'ai fait attention.

original: The two lovers sat face to face, drinking tea.
translated: Les deux amoureux étaient assis face-à-face et buvaient du thé.

original: There is a dance at the French House next Friday.
translated: Il y a un bal à la Maison française vendredi prochain.

original: You can pick out any book you like.
translated: Vous pouvez choisir le livre que vous aimez.

original: Do you like Mozart's music?
translated: Aimez-vous la musique de Mozart ?

original: Tell me you're kidding.
translated: Dis-moi que tu plaisantes !

original: I like discovering new things.
translated: J'aime découvrir de nouvelles choses.

original: Four percent inflation is forecast for this year.
translated: On a prévu quatre pour cent d'inflation pour cette année.

original: If you don't want to do it, you don't have to.
translated: Si vous ne voulez pas le faire, vous n'y êtes pas obligé.

original: I thought you would love it.
translated: Je pensais que vous aimeriez ça.

original: Do you want to leave?
translated: Vous voulez partir ?

original: She needs to find a job.
translated: Elle a besoin de trouver un emploi.

original: Tom runs very fast.
translated: Tom court très vite.

original: There's not enough food for all of us.
translated: Il n'y a pas assez de nourriture pour nous toutes.

original: He cleaned it up.
translated: Il la nettoya.

original: Jimmy insisted on my taking him to the zoo.
translated: Jimmy insista pour que je l'amène au zoo.

original: Will you drink another cup of coffee?
translated: Prendrez-vous encore une tasse de café ?

original: It was noisy.
translated: C'était bruyant.

original: She is poor, but she looks happy.
translated: Elle est pauvre, mais elle a l'air heureuse.

original: Is your office far from here?
translated: Votre bureau est-il loin d'ici ?

original: Tom's choking.
translated: Tom étouffe.

original: Constantine the Great is discussed controversively in modern historical research.
translated: On discute de manière controversée de Constantin le Grand dans les recherches historiques modernes.

original: I'm very concerned.
translated: Je suis très inquiet.

original: He isn't going to buy any bread.
translated: Il n'achète pas de pain.

original: Things happened very quickly.
translated: Les choses se sont déroulées très rapidement.

original: What do you learn?
translated: Qu'apprenez-vous ?

original: Many flights were canceled, owing to the typhoon.
translated: De nombreux vols ont été annulés en raison du typhon.

original: Tom is the leader of Antifa.
translated: Tom est le chef des antifas.

original: I'll lend you my textbook if you promise not to write anything in it.
translated: Je te prêterai mon manuel si tu promets de ne rien y écrire.

original: I helped her into a gown.
translated: Je l'ai aidée à mettre une robe.

original: He's afflicted with leprosy. Don't go near him.
translated: Il a la lèpre, ne t'approche pas de lui.

original: Tom's shoelaces are untied.
translated: Les lacets de Tom sont défaits.

original: There is always something to do.
translated: Il y a toujours quelque chose à faire.

original: I guess you heard about what happened this morning.
translated: Je suppose que tu as entendu dire ce qui s'est produit ce matin.

original: Tom is elected President.
translated: Tom est élu Président.

original: He defeated his opponent in the election.
translated: Il a battu son adversaire électoral.

original: This clock seems to be broken.
translated: Cette horloge semble cassée.

original: I'm no saint.
translated: Je ne suis pas une sainte.

original: Could you tell me who did this?
translated: Pourriez-vous me dire qui a fait ça ?

original: His suicide was a shock for everyone who knew him.
translated: Son suicide a été un choc pour tous ceux qui le connaissaient.

original: Hahaha! Do you want to kill all flies?
translated: Ha ha ha ! Vous voulez tuer toutes les mouches ?

original: You don't have to go to the party if you don't want to.
translated: Tu n'es pas obligé d'aller à la fête si tu ne veux pas.
